g.title: leaf_16
g.text: is for tampering with the global namespace and standard libraries.

g.title: leaf_50
g.text: We shorten a few of the common Lua keywords:

g.title: leaf_73
g.text: In my code there is a repeated pattern of use that is basic enough that I'm
entering it into the global namespace as simple

g.title: leaf_89
g.text: return nil, "utf8: bad second and/or third byte"
local two, three, four = byte(c, 2), byte(c, 3), byte(c, 4)
if continue(two) and continue(three) and continue(four) then
return nil, "utf8: bad second, third, and/or fourth byte"
return nil, "utf8: continuation byte at head"

g.title: leaf_90
g.text: -- make sure we take a bit off anyway

g.title: leaf_86
g.text: This takes a string and validates the first character.

g.title: leaf_88
g.text: Return is either the (valid) length in bytes, or nil and an error string.
